blocks.value: Saint Maria Faustina Kowalska was a Polish nun who received extraordinary visions of Jesus. Through her, Christ revealed His infinite mercy and desire to save all souls, especially the greatest sinners.

Jesus appeared to Faustina and said, 'Paint an image according to the pattern you see, with the signature: Jesus, I Trust in You.' He taught her the Chaplet of Divine Mercy and requested that the Sunday after Easter be celebrated as Divine Mercy Sunday.

Faustina recorded Jesus' messages in her 'Diary,' which has become a spiritual classic. She died of tuberculosis in 1938 at age 33. Pope John Paul II canonized her in 2000, and her message of Divine Mercy has spread worldwide.
